title.narrative: Special American Business Internship Training (SABIT) Program - Unspecified Activities

description.narrative: The SABIT Program receives foreign assistance funds directly through interagency transfers and interagency reimbursable agreements, in which the extending agency is responsible for obligating the foreign assistance funds. The SABIT program office is responsible to expend the funds on goods and services through various DOC procurement mechanisms. The funds are not used for grants or awards to other entities. The data requested for awards are the total amounts of the transfers and reimbursable agreements. The transactions reported are the programs expenditures on goods and services to implement the program.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

title.narrative: Special American Business Internship Training (SABIT) Program - Unspecified Activities

description.narrative: The SABIT Program provides business executives with first-hand, sector-specific experience and training in the U.S. economy, thus enabling them to become leaders in market reform and private-sector development in their home countries and promotes the development of business relationships through the exchange of information between U.S. host companies and SABIT participants.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
